chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
B: poset
A: poset
z: (A * B)%type
y: (A * B)%type
x: (A * B)%type

Goal:
pair_leq x y -> pair_leq y z -> pair_leq x z

Premises:
pair_leq = fun p1 p2 : A * B => p1.1 <== p2.1 /\ p1.2 <== p2.2 : A * B -> A * B -> Prop
pair_asym : forall x y : A * B, pair_leq x y -> pair_leq y x -> x = y
pair_refl : forall x : A * B, pair_leq x x
poset_trans : forall (T : poset) (y x z : T), x <== y -> y <== z -> x <== z
PosetMixin : forall (T : Type) (mx_leq : T -> T -> Prop), (forall x : T, mx_leq x x) -> (forall x y : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y x -> x = y) -> (forall x y z : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y z -> mx_leq x z) -> Poset.mixin_of T
Record mixin_of (T : Type) : Type := Mixin { mx_leq : T -> T -> Prop; _ : forall x : T, mx_leq x x; _ : forall x y : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y x -> x = y; _ : forall x y z : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y z -> mx_leq x z } Arguments Poset.mixin_of _%type_scope Arguments Poset.Mixin [T]%type_scope [mx_leq]%function_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope
sub_trans : forall (T : poset) (s : Pred T) (x : {x : T | x \In s}) (y z : {x0 : T | x0 \In s}), sub_leq x y -> sub_leq y z -> sub_leq x z
BinPosDef.Pos.sub = fun x y : BinNums.positive => match BinPosDef.Pos.sub_mask x y with | BinPosDef.Pos.IsPos z => z | _ => BinNums.xH end : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.sub (_ _)%positive_scope

Record almost_ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_art { ARadd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; ARadd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); ARadd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); ARmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; ARmul_0_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO; ARmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); ARmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rm...
ARadd_assoc : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z)
ARmul_assoc : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z)
ARdistr_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (rmul (radd x y) z) (radd (rmul x z) (rmul y z))
ARmul_assoc1 : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (rmul (rmul x y) z) (rmul (rmul y z) x)
ARmul_assoc2 : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (rmul (rmul y x) z) (rmul (rmul y z) x)
ARadd_assoc2 : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (radd (radd y x) z) (radd (radd y z) x)
poset_asym : forall (T : poset) (x y : T), x <== y -> y <== x -> x = y
sub_asym : forall (T : poset) (s : Pred T) (x : {x : T | x \In s}) (y : {x0 : T | x0 \In s}), sub_leq x y -> sub_leq y x -> x = y
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
BinPos.Pos.le = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Arguments BinPos.Pos.le (_ _)%positive_scope

BinPos.Pos.lt = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Arguments BinPos.Pos.lt (_ _)%positive_scope
Zbool.Zeq_bool = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match BinInt.Z.compare x y with | Eq => true | _ => false end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> bool Arguments Zbool.Zeq_bool (_ _)%Z_scope
Refl.make_impl_map : forall (A B : Type) (eval : A -> Prop) (eval' : A * B -> Prop) (l : seq (A * B)) (r : Prop), (forall x : A * B, eval' x <-> eval x.1) -> Refl.make_impl eval' l r < -> Refl.make_impl eval (List.map fst l) r
ARmul_comm : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x)
ARadd_comm : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x)
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => y | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
Record ring_morph (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R) : Prop := mkmorph { morph0 : req (phi cO) rO; morph1 : req (phi cI) rI; morph_add : forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y)); morph_sub : forall x y : C, req (phi (csub x y)) (rsub (phi x) (phi y)); morph_mul : forall x y : C, req (phi (cmul x y)) (rmul (phi x) (phi y)); morph_opp : forall x...
snd = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (_, y) := p in y : forall A B : Type, A * B -> B Arguments snd {A B}%type_scope
BinPos.Pos.compare_spec : forall x y : BinNums.positive, CompareSpec (x = y) (BinPos.Pos.lt x y) (BinPos.Pos.lt y x) (BinPos.Pos.compare x y)
ARopp_mul_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req (ropp (rmul x y)) (rmul (ropp x) y)

```coq
intros xy z Hxy Hyz.
split.
- transitivity (fst y).
  + apply Hxy.
  + apply Hyz.
- transitivity (snd y).
  + apply Hxy.
  + apply Hyz.
Qed.```
